free: #e There was an old man.
#c 有一個老人。
#e (He) went to an orchard.
#c 去了果園。
#n bo-boway (1) 做肥料的草, (2)剛長出來的水果
#n Note: (1) grass used for fertilizer; (2) newly-grown fruit
#e The trees that he planted have borne fruits.
#c 他的果園長了水果。
#e
#c
#n 零零散散的摘
#n Note: to pick/pluck one by one
#e The old man went to pick the fruits."
#c 那個老人去摘水果了。
#e He picked fruits, but he did not bring any basket."
#c 摘水果，可是都沒有帶著籃子。
#n romokrok 全部摘 pick/pluck everything
#n 'inoka' 沒有準備 not prepared
#n 'inokay koSa' 沒有人提醒 完全沒準備 no reminder from anybody;  #n entirely unprepared
#e (so he used) his clothes-pocket for a basket.
#c 就用衣服的口袋來當作他的籃子。
#e There was a basket put on the ground.
#c 帶著就放在 ... ... 地上，地上有一個剛放下的籃子。
#e He was picking fruits on top of the tree.
#c 他要摘水果的地方非常的高。
#e The old man went up the tree to pick fruits there.
#c 那個老人爬到樹上那邊，在摘水果。
#e A person came pulling a goat.
#c 那裡有一個人拉著一頭羊。
#n kaminoehoeh ka siri'; hoemoehoeh 把東西拉走 to pull something
#e (He) thought this (man) pulling a goat has come to help the old man pick fruits.
#c 他心想，這個拉著羊的人要來幫忙這個老人摘水果。
#n haehaelhaehael
#e (But) that (man) pulling a goat proceeded on his way.
#c 那個拉著羊的人一直走走到另外一邊去了。
#e A child riding on his bike followed.
#c 這個有一個跟在後面 ... ... 有個小孩騎著他的腳踏車。
#e The old man didn't see the child.
#c 那個老人沒有看到那一個小孩。
#e (Because) the old man was up in the tree (and) didn't see.
#c 老人在樹上面那邊，（所以）沒有看到。
#n sahoero不期而遇 meet unexpectedly
#e There (were) the fruits picked by (the old man).
#c 那個老人摘下來的水果，
#e There were two baskets on the ground.
#c 摘了兩個籃子放在地上。
#e
#c
#n takita' 'inak'ino'an 來看一看是什麼樣的 to see what it's like
#n takoSa': yami 'am lobih takoSa' 我們要回去了就這樣說 We are leaving
#n tolaeh ila noka ingangang
#e The child (suddenly/unexpectedly) took one basket and rode on his bike.
#c 不知道怎麼了那個小孩偷了一個籃子，騎著腳踏車帶走了。
#e The old man climbed down from the top of the tree.
#c 那個老人從樹上下來。
#e He saw the basket (of fruits that he) picked.
#c 看著他採的幾籃（水果）。
#e And he said, where has one basket (of fruit) I picked gone?
#c 說道：我剛剛採的那一籃水果跑去哪裡了呢？
#e (The child) rode his bike with all his might and ran away.
#c 小孩子奮力地跑走了。
#e What on earth happened?
#c 他結果怎麼了呢？
#e Later on the road came another child.
#c 在路上又有一個小孩子來了。
#e On the road, two bikes crashed.
#c 兩輛腳踏車相遇。
#e (Two bikes) fell on the ground.
#c 從腳踏車上跌到地上，摔得一踏糊塗。
#n tola'a 鰻魚 eel
#n tolaeh ila ni yaba' pasiayo'on 小孩子不聽話 被爸爸罵的一塌糊塗 the #n child won't listen at all and so was scolded by his father.
#n tolaeh ila noka 'inangang 被罵的一塌糊塗 to be scolded severely
#n toemolaeh ila nanaw
#e The fruits in the basket fell all over the ground.
#c 那籃子裡的水果都灑出來到地上去了。
#e Those (three) children saw (the fall) and said 'what's with this child who fell on the ground?
#c 那邊有很多小孩看到就說：這個小朋友怎麼跌到地上了呢？
#e They went and saw; the fruits have fallen all over the ground.
#c 看到了這些水果倒出來撒在地上。
#e (We) see that all the children then (worked) together to pick up the fruits.
#c 那些小孩子一起撿水果。
#e (They) put (the fruits) in the basket.
#c 放在籃子裡。
#e This way the children were picking up the fruits.
#c 像那樣子小孩子一起撿水果。
#e What on earth has happened?
#c 他怎麼會這樣呢？
#e These children were really bad.
#c 那些小孩都那麼壞，
#n 'ae'aewhay 每一個都很壞every one is bad;
#n 'a'aewhay 比壞還要更壞 worse than bad;
#n lasia ima kakayzaeh 他們每一個人都很好All of them are good.
#e They have not only stolen the fruits, but have also taken and eaten two.
#c 也偷走了那些水果，還吃了兩個。
#e Then the old man said,
#c 然後那個老人說，
#e Where has the basket of fruits which I have picked today gone?
#c 我花了一天採的水果到哪裡去了呢？
#e He looked for (the fruits), but did not find (them).
#c 找呀找呀找呀沒有找到。
#e The child (children) came.
#c 他可能想說這個小孩已有來過。
#e This child took this fruit.
#c 這個水果被小孩子帶走了。
#e Although that (the child took the fruit away), there's nothing wrong with the child's eating the fruit.
#c 雖然那些水果被小孩子吃掉了，那也不錯。
#e Good.
#c 也不錯呀!
#e The old man thought, 'Let the children eat.'
#c 那個老人想說就讓那些小孩子們吃好了。
#e It's all right even if we old people don't eat (the pears).
#c 我們老人即使沒有吃也還好。
#e My story ends here.
#c 我說的故事就到這邊。
#e Thanks.
#c 謝謝。
